True if sorted tuples intervals [t1[ [t2[ intersect

interval.intersection(t1, t2)[source]¶

returns intersection between 2 intervals (tuples), or (None,None) if intervals don’t intersect

interval.intersectlen(t1, t2, none=0)[source]¶

returns len of intersection between 2 intervals (tuples), or none if intervals don’t intersect

class interval.Interval(start, end)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents an interval. Defined as half-open interval [start,end), which includes the start position but not the end. Start and end do not have to be numeric types.

http://code.activestate.com/recipes/576816-interval/ alternative could be http://pypi.python.org/pypi/

Construct, start must be <= end.

__init__(start, end)[source]¶

Construct, start must be <= end.

start¶

The interval’s start

end¶

The interval’s end

class interval.TestCase(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

Create an instance of the class that will use the named test method when executed. Raises a ValueError if the instance does not have a method with the specified name.
